definition[0]: to shake a cloth, a bag, a sheet etc so that any small pieces of dirt, dust etc come off
example[0]: He shook out the handkerchief and put it back in his pocket.
definition[1]: if an organization or industry shakes out, it becomes calmer after a difficult period of time
example[1]: Heâ€™ll look for bargains after the real estate market shakes out.
definition[2]: to change a situation by removing things from it that are not useful or that do not make a profit
example[2]: As the airline industry shakes out all but the very fittest, catering companies could face serious troubles.
definition[3]: if an organization or industry shakes out, it becomes calmer after a difficult period of time. In a market, this happens when weaker companies are forced out of business or bought by bigger companies, leaving fewer competitors
example[3]: He will look for bargains in a year or two, after the real estatemarket shakes out.
definition[4]: to change a situation by removing things about it that are not useful or profitable
